# WORD: External

## Meaning (plain):
capable of being perceived outwardly; having merely the outward appearance of something : superficial; not intrinsic or essential

## Rap meaning (how I'd say it):
Used to describe capable of being perceived outwardly; having merely the outward appearance of something : superficial; not intrinsic or essential in a bar.

## Syllables:
3 (ex-ter-nal)

## Part of speech:
adjective

## Synonyms:
accidental, adventitious, alien, extraneous, extrinsic, foreign

## Antonyms:
inherent, innate, intrinsic, inner

## Rhyme ideas (end / slant / multi):
END: all, fall, call / SLANT: ball, stall, crawl / MULTI: stand tall, heed the call, never fall

## 3 bar-ready examples:
1. External in my cadence, heavy like a drumline.
2. I move with External, every step a headline.
3. External on the mic, watch the room align.

## 3 punchline angles:
1. Power/control imagery
2. Scale/impact flex
3. Momentum/pressure metaphor

## Tags:
relatable, common
